question: Daisy is making this card. What should she write on the card?

Ann: I’m going to Phuket this long weekend.
Bell: Wow! How are you travelling and for how long?
Ann: I’ll drive and stay there for three days.

Which sentence is correct?
choices: Bell is driving Ann to Phuket.
Ann is going to Phuket by car.
Bell and Ann are staying in Phuket.
Ann and Bell are planning a trip to Phuket.
correct_answer: Ann is going to Phuket by car.

question: Which picture shows an American sport?
Platypus is the only animal that has no stomach. Which sentence is correct?
choices: A platypus does not have a stomach.
Every animal does not have a stomach.
correct_answer: A platypus does not have a stomach.

question: My brothers and sister are visiting me tomorrow. Charlotte is my sister. George and Louis are my brothers. I’m happy to see them all. Which sentence is correct?
choices: Three people are coming to my house.
Charlotte, George, Louis and their brothers are visiting me.
Charlotte, George and their sisters are coming to my house.
correct_answer: Three people are coming to my house.

question: Look at the notice. What is the best name for the notice?
Look at the sign. What does the sign mean?
choices: You can watch TV programs here.
A microphone makes your voice louder.

question:
After having lunch at the canteen
Matt: Can we leave the plates on the table?
Ryan: I don’t think so. Look at the sign.
Which sign are they talking about?

John: I want iced cocoa. What about you?
Leah: Just milk. Umm, cold milk is better.
How much do they have to pay in total?
Students got lower scores in many subjects in 2021. They did better only in maths. Which bar graph is correct?

Jennifer walks from the shop on East Road, turns left at the corner and turns right onto West Road. When she arrives at Main Road, she turns left and crosses the road to the pizzeria. Which map is correct?
Which sentence is correct?
choices: And I go to once a week the museum my friends.
Once a week go to the museum my friends and I.
Go to the museum and I my friends once a week.
My friends and I go to the museum once a week.
correct_answer: My friends and I go to the museum once a week.

question: Which question has a different intonation?
Which sentence has the correct punctuation?

Trisha: This must be _______. The fireworks are always amazing.
Mali: No, it’s not. It’s the Loy Krathong festival in Thailand.

Ava: You’re having rice and chicken again.
Lucas: Sure! _______
Ava: I can’t have the same dish every day.
choices: I hate rice. You love spaghetti.
You love noodles. I hate chicken.

question:
Ron: Hey, Sarah! You look tired. What’s the matter?
Sarah: _______ I think I’ve caught COVID-19.

Brad: Did he steal anything?
Alisha: _______ But he ate all my food!

Paula: I should get back to my class.
Sean: Me, too. _______

Matt: Oh, I didn’t bring my English book today.
Greg: Don’t worry. We can share.
Matt: _______

Rose: Could you help me write an essay?
Sonia: _______ I haven’t finished mine yet.

Zara: Mike is cute.
Sophie: _______ He’s a friend of mine, Jerry.

During the exam
Student: _______
Teacher: Yes. But come right back.
choices: May I go to the restroom?
Should I come in the room?
Would you like to go home?
correct_answer: May I go to the restroom?

question:
Meg: After the final exam I’m going to make a knitted doll. What about you?
Bob: _______
choices: I’ll do the exam very well.
I’ll work on my stamp collection.
You’ll watch a hit television series.
You’ll give me a gift from the north.
correct_answer: I’ll work on my stamp collection.

question:
Adele: I have a headache.
Sharon: _______
Adele: All right. I will.
choices: You might go to visit your grandma.
You can choose a vaccine or a mask.
You would like to be a doctor or a nurse.
You should take a pill and get some sleep.
correct_answer: You should take a pill and get some sleep.

question:
William: You played very well. How long have you been playing?
James: _______

Liam: How can I get to your house?
Willy: Very easy. _______ and get off at the post office. I’ll wait for you there.

Aunt: I can’t send a message to my friend. _______
Nephew: Sure! It’s easy.
choices: Can you help me with it?
correct_answer: Can you help me with it?

question:
Siri: What do you think? Should we bring the dog?
Ted: That’d be great! _______

Evelyn: How was the movie last night?
Ivy: _______
choices: I didn’t read it. I told my classmates about it.
I’m not funny. I told a joke to my classmates.
I’m not tired. I went for a walk for 10 minutes.
I didn’t like it. I fell asleep after the first 10 minutes.
correct_answer: I didn’t like it. I fell asleep after the first 10 minutes.

question:
Abe: Did you hear that? I heard thunder.
Yuki: Oh, no! _______

Son: I’m not sleepy, Mom.
Mom: It’s very late now. _______ It’s time to sleep.
choices: Switch off the light and study.
Turn off the TV and go to bed.
Switch on the light and exercise.
Turn on the TV and do your homework.
correct_answer: Turn off the TV and go to bed.
